title: The â€œNo-Makeup Makeupâ€ Manicure Is Like A Tinted Moisturizer For Nails
description: The best thing about this yearâ€™s biggest nail trends is that there really is a look for everyone. With pistachio green manicures,Â and jewelry nailsÂ for the maximalists, glossyÂ soap nails,Â andÂ elevated French manicuresÂ for those who prefer a quieter manicure, thereâ€™s no shortage of nail inspiration. Just when we thought there was no more space for another minimalist manicure to capture our attention, the â€œno-makeup makeupâ€ nail trend has emerged as the freshest look for spring and summer. Pared-back and beautifully simple, itâ€™s effectively the equivalent of a tinted moisturizer for your nails; it adds polish and glow while letting your natural nail shine through. But what sets it apart from the other subtle manicures dominating this spring?Â  View this post on Instagram A post shared by Cerise ğŸ’ (@glossytipped) What is the â€œno-makeup makeupâ€ manicure? Also known as a â€œnakedâ€ or barely-there manicure, the â€œno-makeup makeupâ€ manicure is all about enhancing your natural nails rather than covering them up. â€œSheer, clean nails exude low-maintenance and effortless sophistication,â€ says manicurist and Bio Sculpture nail technician Julia Diogo. â€œThis barely-there manicure really does deliver â€˜your-nails-but-betterâ€™, and with the right shade and topcoat, not only is your natural nail plate enhanced, but so is your skin tone.â€ The key to the look is opting for sheer, neutral tones with a shiny finish. Youâ€™re aiming for a â€œcleanâ€, healthy, well-groomed look thatâ€™s so versatile.Â  View this post on Instagram A post shared by Georgia Rae (@raelondonnails) How do you create the no-makeup makeup manicure? The secret to the no-makeup makeup manicure is that while it looks simple, it relies on careful prep and precision: â€œCuticle work and shaping are essential in my prep to create this manicure,â€ says Diogo. â€œWe want to avoid over-trimming the cuticles, so lightly buff to enhance the nail platesâ€™ natural shine and cleanse your hands and nails beforehand to ensure the polish adheres as evenly as possible.â€ @the_gelbottle_inc Create â€˜No-Makeup Makeupâ€™ nails with @Amber using Blanc, Daisy and Kiss BIABâ„¢ ğŸ€ğŸ’… This trend is all about your nails, but betterâ€”perfect for fans of the clean girl aesthetic ğŸ«§ #tgb #thegelbottle #thegelbottleinc #cleangirl #nomakeup #nomakeupmakeup â™¬ Spring Is Coming â€“ Morunas Diogo points out that you want this manicure to be applied thinly; no bulky textures, just a couple of fine coats of polish for that natural look. As for colors? Sheer creams, translucent pinks, and soft nudes are what you want to look for, rather than anything too milky or opaque. â€œIâ€™d also finish the nail into soft, short square or almond with a shiner tool and use a glossy topcoat to execute as cleanly as possible,â€ says Diogo. Want to achieve the look yourself? Here are some of our favorite â€œno-makeup makeupâ€ manicures to inspire your next nail look. Your Nails But Better View this post on Instagram A post shared by Iram Shelton (@irams.jpeg) Chic, simple, and executed perfectly, celebrity nail artist Iram Shelton created this elevated manicure using a combination of OPI Bare My Soul, $11.45, and OPI Put It In Neutral, $11.99. Weâ€™ll be rushing to recreate it at home.Â  Soft Oval View this post on Instagram A post shared by LHB Nails (@lhb_nails) This elongated oval nail is the ideal shape to complement this barely-there look created by manicurist LHB Nails. Micro Tips View this post on Instagram A post shared by Mateja Novakovic (@matejanova) Content creator Mateja Novakovic is the queen of the minimalist manicure, and this iteration is so chic. Opt for a pink-toned polish like Chanel Le Vernis Nail Color in 111 Ballerina, $33, to achieve a similar sheer look. High Shine View this post on Instagram A post shared by Julia Diogo (@paintedbyjools) Nailing the fresh manicure, the incredible Julia Diogo (aka @paintedbyjools) used just one product to create this no-makeup makeup manicure â€” Essieâ€™s To The Rescue UV Damage Repair Nail Treatment, $12. Clean CrÃ©me View this post on Instagram A post shared by Millie Flemming (@millieflemming_) Opt for a squoval nail and a creamy rose shade, like Essie Nail Art Studio Jelly Gloss Nail Polish, $13, to recreate manicurist Millie Flemmingâ€™s beautiful tinted manicure. Moisture Surge View this post on Instagram A post shared by Georgia Rae (@raelondonnails) Think of this slick nail look by manicurist Georgia Rae (aka @raelondonnails) like wearing a lip gloss on your nails; itâ€™s all about the shine.Â  This story was originally published on Refinery29 UK. excerpt: Pared-back and beautifully simple, the no-makeup makeup manicure is the equivalent of a tinted moisturizer for your nails

Youâ€™re aiming for a â€œcleanâ€, healthy, well-groomed look thatâ€™s so versatile.Â How do you create the no-makeup makeup manicure?The secret to the no-makeup makeup manicure is that while it looks simple, it relies on careful prep and precision: â€œCuticle work and shaping are essential in my prep to create this manicure,â€ says Diogo. â€œWe want to avoid over-trimming the cuticles, so lightly buff to enhance the nail platesâ€™ natural shine and cleanse your hands and nails beforehand to ensure the polish adheres as evenly as possible.â€Diogo points out that you want this manicure to be applied thinly; no bulky textures, just a couple of fine coats of polish for that natural look. All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.

Just when we thought there was no more space for another minimalist manicure to capture our attention, the â€œno-makeup makeupâ€ nail trend has emerged as the freshest look for spring and summer. Pared-back and beautifully simple, it's effectively the equivalent of a tinted moisturizer for your nails; it adds polish and glow while letting your natural nail shine through. But what sets it apart from the other subtle manicures dominating this spring?Â 

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

Also known as a â€œnakedâ€ or barely-there manicure, the â€œno-makeup makeupâ€ manicure is all about enhancing your natural nails rather than covering them up.

â€œSheer, clean nails exude low-maintenance and effortless sophistication,â€ says manicurist and Bio Sculpture nail technician Julia Diogo. â€œThis barely-there manicure really does deliver 'your-nails-but-better', and with the right shade and topcoat, not only is your natural nail plate enhanced, but so is your skin tone.â€ The key to the look is opting for sheer, neutral tones with a shiny finish. Youâ€™re aiming for a â€œcleanâ€, healthy, well-groomed look thatâ€™s so versatile.Â 

How do you create the no-makeup makeup manicure?

The secret to the no-makeup makeup manicure is that while it looks simple, it relies on careful prep and precision: â€œCuticle work and shaping are essential in my prep to create this manicure,â€ says Diogo. â€œWe want to avoid over-trimming the cuticles, so lightly buff to enhance the nail platesâ€™ natural shine and cleanse your hands and nails beforehand to ensure the polish adheres as evenly as possible.â€

Diogo points out that you want this manicure to be applied thinly; no bulky textures, just a couple of fine coats of polish for that natural look. As for colors? Sheer creams, translucent pinks, and soft nudes are what you want to look for, rather than anything too milky or opaque. â€œIâ€™d also finish the nail into soft, short square or almond with a shiner tool and use a glossy topcoat to execute as cleanly as possible,â€ says Diogo.
